t: Psalm 59
God Our Stronghold
For the choir director: “Do Not Destroy.” A Miktam of David. When Saul sent agents to watch the house and kill him.
Rescue*pn me from my enemies, my God; protect*ln me from those who rise up against me.
Rescue*ln me from evildoers, and*ln save me from men of bloodshed.
Because*ln look, Lord,*s they set an ambush for me. Powerful*ln men attack me, but*ln not because of any sin or rebellion of mine.
For*ln no fault of mine, they*ln run and take up a position. Awake*ln to help me, and take notice.
Lord*sln God of Armies, you are the God of Israel. Rise*ln up to punish all the nations; do*ln not show favor to any wicked traitors. Selah*ig
They*pn return at evening, snarling like dogs and*ln prowling around the city.
Look,*ln they spew from their mouths — sharp*ln words from their lips. “For*ln who,” they say, “will hear?”
But*ln you laugh at them, Lord;*s you*ln ridicule all the nations.
I*ln will keep watch for you, my strength, because*ln God is my stronghold.
My*ln faithful God will come to meet me; God*ln will let me look down on my adversaries.
Do*pn not kill them; otherwise, my people will forget. By*ln your power, make them homeless wanderers and*ln bring them down, Lord,*ln our shield.
For*ln the sin of their mouths and the words of their lips, let*ln them be caught in their pride. They*ln utter curses and lies.
Consume*ln them in fury; consume*ln them until they are gone. Then*ln people will know throughout the earth that*ln God rules over Jacob. Selah*ig
And*pn they return at evening, snarling like dogs and*ln prowling around the city.
They*ln scavenge for food; they*ln growl if they are not satisfied.
But*pn I will sing of your strength and*ln will joyfully proclaim your*ln faithful love in the morning. For*ln you have been a stronghold for me, a*ln refuge in my day of trouble.
To*ln you, my strength, I sing praises, because*ln God is my stronghold — my*ln faithful God.
